Package alix.lucene.search

Class FieldText

  • java.lang.Object
    • alix.lucene.search.FieldText
  • public class FieldText
extends Object

    An object recording different stats for a lucene text field. Is stable according to a state of the index, could be cached. Record all counts useful for stats. For performances, all fields of the class are visible, so it is unsafe.

    Provide slices of stats for Terms as s sorted Iterator

    Author:
    fred

    • Constructor Detail

      • FieldText

        public FieldText​(org.apache.lucene.index.DirectoryReader reader,
                 String fieldName)
          throws IOException
        Build the dictionaries and stats. Each form indexed for the field will be identified by an int (formid). This id will be in freq order, so that the form with formid=1 is the most frequent for the index (formId=0 is the empty string). This order allows optimizations for co-occurrences matrix,
        Parameters:
        reader -
        fieldName -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • iterator

        public FormEnum iterator​(int limit,
                         Tag.TagFilter tags,
                         boolean reverse)
        Global termlist, maybe filtered but not scored. More efficient than a scorer that loop on each term for global.
        Returns:

      • docStats

        public FieldText.DocStats docStats​(String[] forms,
                                   Specif specif,
                                   org.apache.lucene.util.BitSet filter)
                            throws IOException
        Because a sorted query will not calculate scores, here is something to have stats for docs about a query.
        Throws:

      • iterator

        public FormEnum iterator​(int limit,
                         Specif specif,
                         org.apache.lucene.util.BitSet filter,
                         Tag.TagFilter tags,
                         boolean reverse)
                  throws IOException
        Count of occurrences by term for a subset of the index, defined as a BitSet. Returns an iterator sorted according to a scorer. If scorer is null, default is count of occurences.
        Throws:
        IOException
